citations.narrative:
The acquisition and disposition records did not contain the required information. Only the year was documented for
animals born at the facility as well as for animals who died or were given away. Without records which fully disclose the
animal’s acquisition as well as disposition information, legal and medical information traceback is not possible. Develop
and maintain records disclosing the required acquisition/disposition information including the date, name, address, and
USDA number if applicable of the person from whom the animal was acquired from or given to. The records shall include
any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct by June 5, 2024.

At the time of inspection, at least three enclosures were identified with a damaged section of the metal fencing creating
sharp points protruding into the space occupied by the animals. Sharp points protruding inside animal housing areas may
result in injury while damaged fencing may fail to adequately contain the animals. The outdoor housing facilities shall be
structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
Correct by June 12, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The acquisition and disposition records did not contain the required information. Only the year was documented for 
animals born at the facility as well as for animals who died or were given away. Without records which fully disclose the 
animal’s acquisition as well as disposition information, legal and medical information traceback is not possible. Develop 
and maintain records disclosing the required acquisition/disposition information including the date, name, address, and 
USDA number if applicable of the person from whom the animal was acquired from or given to. The records shall include 
any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Correct by June 5, 2024. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
At the time of inspection, at least three enclosures were identified with a damaged section of the metal fencing creating 
sharp points protruding into the space occupied by the animals. Sharp points protruding inside animal housing areas may 
result in injury while damaged fencing may fail to adequately contain the animals. The outdoor housing facilities shall be 
structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. 
Correct by June 12, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
